item.title: Directing the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make corrections in the enrollment of H.R. 4818.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.title: Making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year 2005, and for other purposes.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 233 - 158 (Roll no. 540).
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 233 - 158 (Roll no. 540).
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H10097)

POSTPONED VOTE - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 866 the Chair put the question on adoption of the resolution and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Baird objected to the vote based on the absence of a quorum and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of agreeing to the resolution until later in the legislative day. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
DEBATE - The House resumed debate on H. Res. 866.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 866.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H10087-10096; text of measure as reported in House: CR H10087)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 257.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 114 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-794, by Mr. Putnam.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-794, by Mr. Putnam.

summary.text:
Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 4818 (Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2005).

Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.J. Res. 114 (further continuing appropriations for FY 2005).

Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 4818 (Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2005).

Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.J. Res. 114 (further continuing appropriations for FY 2005).

Provides for the adoption of H.Con.Res. 528 (correcting the enrollment of H.R. 4818).

bill.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 4818) making appropriations for foreign operations, export financing, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2005, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 114) making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year 2005, and for other purposes.

amendment.description: At the end of the resolution add the following: \ SEC. 3. Upon the adoption of this resolution, the House shall be considered to have adopted House Concurrent Resolution 528.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to add a new section at the end of the bill stating that upon the adoption of this resolution, the House shall be considered to have adopted House Concurrent Resolution 528.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Putnam amendment Agreed to by voice vote.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
